description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Windows Nearby Sharing spoofing vulnerability (CVE-2024-20690):

1. Download and apply the appropriate updates for your Windows version from the official Microsoft Update Catalog.
2. Restart your system after installation to ensure the updates are effectively applied.

**Details**:
- The updates associated with CVE-2024-20690 address spoofing vulnerabilities in Nearby Sharing. This includes updates KB5034121, KB5034122, and KB5034123, applicable to different builds of Windows 10 and Windows 11.
- Additional updates can be found here:
  - [KB5034127](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034127)
  - [KB5034121](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034121)
  - [KB5034122](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034122)
  - [KB5034123](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034123)

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure your system is online to download updates.
- It is advisable to backup critical data before applying any updates.
